bequeath.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to officially arrange for someone to have something that you own after your death
bequeath.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She bequeathed her collection of paintings to the National Gallery.
His father bequeathed him a fortune.
bequeath.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to pass knowledge, customs etc to people who come after you or live after you
bequeath.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to officially arrange for someone to have money or property that you own after your death, by writing it in your WILL
bequeath.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Sharp left the museum nothing, instead bequeathing his collection to a charitable foundation.
He bequeathed his wife 514 acres of arable land.
